title: Immune-Related Adverse Events for Lung Toxicity - Pneumonitis
desc: The Immune-Related Adverse Events for Lung Toxicity - Pneumonitis grades severity of pneumonitis secondary to immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.

orgreference.text: Brahmer JR, Lacchetti C, Schneider BJ, et al. Management of Immune-Related Adverse Events in Patients Treated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Therapy: American Society of Clinical Oncology Clinical Practice Guideline. J Clin Oncol. 2018;36(17):1714-1768.

data.evidence:
Criteria

Pneumonitis grade

Asymptomatic, confined to one lobe of the lung or <25% of lung parenchyma, clinical, or diagnostic observations only

G1

Symptomatic, involves more than one lobe of the lung or 25-50% of lung parenchyma, medical intervention indicated, limiting instrumental ADL

G2

Severe symptoms, hospitalization required, involves all lung lobes or >50% of lung parenchyma, limiting self-care ADL, oxygen indicated

G3

Life-threatening respiratory compromise, urgent intervention indicated (intubation) 

G4

See Next Steps for details on management.
